body:
[P0] `ClawdbotConfig` type isn’t imported/defined in this file

In `resolve-route.test.ts`, the new test declares `const cfg: ClawdbotConfig = { ... }`, but the file only imports `MoltbotConfig` (`import type { MoltbotConfig } from "../config/config.js";`). Unless `ClawdbotConfig` is a global type (unlikely in TS), this will fail type-checking. It’s also inconsistent with the other tests in this file which use `MoltbotConfig`.

Also appears in `src/security/audit.test.ts:735` (uses `ClawdbotConfig` as well).

<details><summary>Prompt To Fix With AI</summary>

`````markdown
This is a comment left during a code review.
Path: src/routing/resolve-route.test.ts
Line: 83:90

Comment:
[P0] `ClawdbotConfig` type isn’t imported/defined in this file

In `resolve-route.test.ts`, the new test declares `const cfg: ClawdbotConfig = { ... }`, but the file only imports `MoltbotConfig` (`import type { MoltbotConfig } from "../config/config.js";`). Unless `ClawdbotConfig` is a global type (unlikely in TS), this will fail type-checking. It’s also inconsistent with the other tests in this file which use `MoltbotConfig`.

Also appears in `src/security/audit.test.ts:735` (uses `ClawdbotConfig` as well).

How can I resolve this? If you propose a fix, please make it concise.
`````
</details>

[P1] `linkedPeerId` is used as a boolean switch, but it’s derived from the *pre-normalized* `peerId` and `dmScope !== "main"`. This can diverge from the actual canonicalization decision if `resolveLinkedPeerId` returns a canonical name with leading/trailing whitespace (it’s returned as `canonical.trim()` but not lowercased), or if `peerId` becomes empty/normalized differently.

Concretely: `peerId` is later lowercased and used in the key, but the early return uses `if (linkedPeerId)` rather than checking whether `peerId` was actually rewritten to a linked canonical id. This is a subtle coupling that can produce unexpected session keys if `resolveLinkedPeerId` ever changes its normalization rules.

A safer check is to key off `peerId !== originalPeerId` (or return a `{ canonicalPeerId, wasLinked }` tuple).


<details><summary>Prompt To Fix With AI</summary>

`````markdown
This is a comment left during a code review.
Path: src/routing/session-key.ts
Line: 135:137

Comment:
[P1] `linkedPeerId` is used as a boolean switch, but it’s derived from the *pre-normalized* `peerId` and `dmScope !== "main"`. This can diverge from the actual canonicalization decision if `resolveLinkedPeerId` returns a canonical name with leading/trailing whitespace (it’s returned as `canonical.trim()` but not lowercased), or if `peerId` becomes empty/normalized differently.

Concretely: `peerId` is later lowercased and used in the key, but the early return uses `if (linkedPeerId)` rather than checking whether `peerId` was actually rewritten to a linked canonical id. This is a subtle coupling that can produce unexpected session keys if `resolveLinkedPeerId` ever changes its normalization rules.

A safer check is to key off `peerId !== originalPeerId` (or return a `{ canonicalPeerId, wasLinked }` tuple).


How can I resolve this? If you propose a fix, please make it concise.
`````
</details>
